data.title: Atom command line tool?
data.body:
I usually open whatever I'm working on from the command line:

```
subl .
```

Is there an `atom` tool I can install? I looked in the app but couldn't find anything.

data.title: Changing the syntax theme broke the content view?
data.body:
I changed my syntax theme by removing the default and dragging `solarized-dark-syntax` over. Then I switch back to an existing tab it was just a wall of gray. I tried opening a new tab and it too was a wall of gray.

After I quit and re-opened, it was fine.

data.title: tabLength doesn't use config.observe
data.body: For example, if I change the tab size, I have to close my existing tabs and re-open them to see the change.

data.title: Preferences take a long time to open and close
data.body: On my machine, preferences take ~2 seconds to open and close.

data.title: I'd sure be nice if I could type newlines in this f
data.body:
I'd sure be nice if I could type newlines in this feedback box.

data.title: It seems like support for files w/open buffers movi
data.body:
It seems like support for files w/open buffers moving around + disappearing is just getting worse and worse. Just delete a file or folder that's in an open buffer via the tree-view to see the simplest case. I moved a few files around in a refactoring, and then did a global find, which showed me results from deleted files with open buffers. Now I get to clean up the entire directory structure again. Being asked to save nonexistent files every time I close this editor is still a thing. How are y'all not hitting these issues every day?

User: jbarnette
Atom Version: 3053c4a
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/3053c4a Safari/537.36

data.title: Prefer npm created node_modules/.bin/grunt
data.body: It is more reliable to use the `grunt` binary created by npm in the `node_modules/.bin/` folder. This way if the path or name of the binary gets updated or installed another way (see gruntjs/grunt#943), the path `node_modules/.bin/grunt` will always remain the same.

data.title: Opening a new atom instance: cursor is at the bottom of the file
data.body: Open a new editor instance, scroll is where it left off, cursor is at the bottom. I hit up or whatever, and it scrolls to the bottom. Annoying!

data.title: Prevent infinite loop in erb grammar
data.body: @cameronmcefee found an infinite loop crash over in atom/language-ruby-on-rails#1

data.title: Ruby completion still spits out regexes
data.body:
When I type the following in ruby file:

```
something do<tab>
```

I expect this:

```
something do |<cursor here>|

end
```

But I get this:

```
response.each do${1/(^(?<var>\s*[a-z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\s*)(,\g<var>)*,?\s*$)|.*/(?1: |)/}variable${1/(^(?<var>\s*[a-z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\s*)(,\g<var>)*,?\s*$)|.*/(?1:|)/}

end
```

Several other tab completion things do the same in ruby.

data.title: Everything is terrible after submitting feedback
data.body:
Everything is terrible after submitting feedback

(aka lots of crashing when I try to close the window).
## Steps to reproduce
1. Open a new window, enter some text
2. Click the feedback :zap: button
3. Close the feeback window via escape
4. Close the Atom window via the red button in the top left corner
## Expected

Window closes, possibly prompting me to save
## Actual

Even the errors have errors
## Screencast

![everything-is-terrible](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/282759/1676890/ea18c066-5d20-11e3-8ead-bda8084b4132.gif)

User: @benbalter
Atom Version: 0.41.0
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/0.41.0 Safari/537.36

data.title:
Up and down arrows don't work in feedback box.

##
data.body:
Up and down arrows don't work in feedback box.
## Steps to reproduce
1. Open feedback window, type text
2. Attempt to go to a higher or lower line than the line currently being edited
## Expected

Pressing up or down arrow will move the cursor
## Actual

Frustration and sadness.

data.title: Feedback box should have a close button, or auto cl
data.body:
Feedback box should have a close button, or auto close when it looses focus.
## Steps to reproduce:
1. Click the lightning icon
2. See a cool new feature
3. Decide you don't want to give feedback
## Expected

Click a small X or similar to close the window
## Actual

Can't close the window (esc works, but not obvious)

User: @benbalter
Atom Version: 0.41.0
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Atom/0.41.0 Safari/537.36

data.title: Full path hint hangs around after file/tab is closed
data.body: If you hover over an open tab, you get a little hint popup showing the full path of the file open therein, which is cool.  Problem is, if you happen to close that tab with CMD-w whilst it's up, apparently it never goes away, and hangs around pointing to tabs that are clearly NOT that file any more.

data.title: Update to atom-shell v0.7.4.
search highlights will "shift" when you undo/redo typing
data.body: The highlighted search result box around text moves in strange ways when I move the cursor.
